comment: This pattern is designed to match the introduction block of an ORCA output file. It looks for a sequence of 17 asterisks, possibly surrounded by spaces or tabs, followed by a line that spells O R C A with each letter separated by three spaces, each flanked by asterisks. The entire block is expected to be surrounded by newlines.
Searching for the fin of orca, assuming that the icon ends at the first empty line
Non-special line is defined by (?!.*[-*#=]{7,})(?!.*<@%)(?!.*%@>)(?:(?!\n).)*. <@% %@> is the internal marker for blocks.
Standard pattern: Starts with, non-empty lines then one more non-empty line, but \n is outside of the main search bracket
Standard pattern: Starts with, non-empty lines then one more non-empty line, but \n is outside of the main search bracket

pattern: ^([ \t]*Your ORCA version has been built with support for libXC.*?\n([ \t]*\S.*\n)*[ \t]*\S.*)$
comment: Standard pattern: Starts with, non-empty lines then one more non-empty line, but \n is outside of the main search bracket
Standard pattern: Starts with, non-empty lines then one more non-empty line, but \n is outside of the main search bracket

Starts with ===, then WARNINGS, then up to 3 non-special lines inside of header, then ===, then non-special lines, then one more non-special line, but \n is outside of the main search bracket. Non-special line is defined by (?!.*[-*#=]{7,})(?!.*<@%)(?!.*%@>)(?:(?!\n).)*. Non-special line might be empty. <@% %@> is the internal marker for blocks.

Starts with Orbital basis set information, then non-empty non-special lines, then one more non-special line, but \n is outside of the main search bracket. Non-special line is defined by (?!.*[-*#=]{7,})(?!.*<@%)(?!.*%@>)(?:(?!\n).)*. <@% %@> is the internal marker for blocks.

Starts with Orbital basis set information, then non-empty non-special lines, then one more non-special line, but \n is outside of the main search bracket. Non-special line is defined by (?!.*[-*#=]{7,})(?!.*<@%)(?!.*%@>)(?:(?!\n).)*. <@% %@> is the internal marker for blocks.
Header then wait till === line will reappear
Header then non-special non-empty lines
Header then non-special non-empty lines

This pattern matches the final single point energy block in an ORCA output file. It looks for a line of 25 dashes, followed by a line with FINAL SINGLE POINT ENERGY, and then the energy value represented by an optional minus sign followed by one or more digits, a period, and more digits. This is encapsulated within a pattern of dashes that frame the title and the value.

This pattern captures the total runtime block in an ORCA output, displaying the computation time in days, hours, minutes, seconds, and milliseconds. Each time unit is followed by its respective label (e.g., days, hours), and the values can be any number of digits.

Assumes that List of optional additional citation will be present in the citations block. It is followed by empty line and then nonempty non-special lines.  Non-empty non-special line is defined by (?!^[ \t]*$)(?!.*[-*#=]{7,})(?!.*<@%)(?!.*%@>)(?:(?!\n).)*. <@% %@> is the internal marker for blocks.

This pattern is intended to identify the timings for individual modules within an ORCA computation. It starts with the heading Timings for individual modules:, followed by up to four newlines, then captures multiple lines that describe individual modules and their timings in seconds. Each module line includes the module name followed by an ellipsis and the timing in seconds, potentially followed by additional text, before ending with a newline.

This pattern stands for -*#= line followed by no more then 2 non-special lines then -*#= line then non-special lines then -*#= line. Non-special line is defined by (?!.*[-*#=]{7,})(?!.*<@%)(?!.*%@>)(?:(?!\n).)*. Non-special line might be empty. <@% %@> is the internal marker for blocks. This is the final attempt to recognize the blocks with headers. Does not work with DOTALL. Is repeated twice cause overlap.

This pattern stands for -*#= line followed by no more then 2 non-special lines then -*#= line then non-special lines then -*#= line. Non-special line is defined by (?!.*[-*#=]{7,})(?!.*<@%)(?!.*%@>)(?:(?!\n).)*. Non-special line might be empty. <@% %@> is the internal marker for blocks with headerss. This is the final attempt to recognize the block. Does not work with DOTALL. Is repeated twice cause overlap.
